RainbruRPG::Exception::Console

RainbruRPG::Exception::Console Class Reference

#include <console.h>

Inheritance diagram for RainbruRPG::Exception::Console:

[legend]
Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Exception::Console:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

The debugging console.

This is the developper reference of the Console class. If you want to know how to use the console, you should see this page.

This singleton class is used to create an console. It provides in-game access to ConsoleObject. You can move the console's scrollbar with the PAGEUP PAGEDOWN keys and call former commands with the UP and DOWN ones.

To provides the access of multiple command in a single object, we use a Namespace function. With the using keyword, you can preselect an object that will be used for the attribute access until you choose to set the namespace to none (by calling using none).

If the function's name start with command, it treat a console's command. ex: commandShowObject treat the show object_name command.

The Console is created only if you call it and is keeping in memory when you hide it. So it will never take CPU charge if you do not use it but once you have call it, it will always stay in memory.

The console has its own event receiver : RainbruRPG::Events::erConsole, and it is shown/hiden by the GameEngine showConsole() and hideConsole() method.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::commandUsingObject ( std::string  s  )  [private]

Treat the using object command.

If the s parameter is none, we set prompt to L"".

We check if the object exists. If it exists, the name is passed to the prompt.

bool RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::getTokenizerError ( tTokentizerReturn *  t  )  [private]

Get the errors returned by the tokenizer.

Show the errors message in the console

return true if we must parse the command (no errors), false if the tokenizer has found an error.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::hide (  ) 

This method is called by the Events receiver to hide the console.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::init (  ) 

The singleton's constructor.

It gets all the Irrlicht values ( device, driver, scene manager and guiEnvironment) from the GameEngine. Then it sets scrollValue to 18, create the Tokenizer and TokenizerDbg instances and call initObjectsVector().

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::initObjectsVector (  )  [private]

Load all the ConsoleObjects in the vector.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::initScrollbar (  ) 

The listbox's scrollbar access initialization.

The scrollbar of the listbox is created at the same time but no function in the Irrlicht API provides acces to the scrollbar. So we must keep a pointer to it that we initialize one time by a call in the createConsole() method.

bool RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::quadCommand ( tTokentizerReturn *   )  [private]

Treat a quad command (with 3 tokens).

The first type of quad command is set obj.attrb val

Returns:
true if the command is found (used), false if we must continue parsing the tokens (command not found)

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::setDown (  ) 

Provides the next command mecanism.

erConsole.cpp call this method if the DOWN key is pressed.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::setEnd (  ) 

Set the listbox always showing the last line.

This code come from the Irrlicht forum. Thanks to jox.

In the listbox the scrollbar max depends on the number of items in it. 0x7FFFFFFF is a hexadecimal value. If the int would be unsigned (no minus values possible) the highest value would be 0xFFFFFFFF (all bits set). An unsigned uses one bit for the (minus) sign. So 0x7FFFFFFF sets all bits exept the sign bit to get the highest positive value. This value is maybe overkill , 10000 would probaly do as well, but its theoretically the most optimal value in this situation.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::setHome (  ) 

Go to the first line of the listbox.

When we hit the HOME key, the event receiver (RainbruRPG::Events::erConsole) call this method to go to the first line of the console.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::setPageDown (  ) 

Set the scrollbar down according to the scrollvalue value.

This method is called by the console event receiver (RainbruRPG::Events::erConsole) when we hit the DOWN arrow key.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::setPageUp (  ) 

Set the scrollbar up according to the scrollvalue value.

This method is called by the console event receiver (RainbruRPG::Events::erConsole) when we hit the UP arrow key.

void RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::showIndentedMessage ( irr::core::stringw  s  )  [private]

Add an indented line to the listbox to show a message.

It use the getIndentedString() function to get the right space number (indentation) and append the message to it. Then adds this new line to the listBox.

Parameters:

bool RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::simpleCommand ( irr::core::stringw  s  )  [private]

Treat the simple command.

simple commands are in only one word :

  • clear;
  • help;
  • list.
  • show
  • count

Returns:
true if the command is found (we stop all search), false to continue searching.

Member Data Documentation

int RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::cmdIndex [private]

The index of the current command.

This integer value is set to 0 in the init() method and is incremented by 1 at each enter key hitting.

vector<consoleCmd> RainbruRPG::Exception::Console::cmdVector [private]

The command recall vector.

To provides the recalling of the former commands and the list command result, we keep all the command in this vector
